dialogueTree.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Hissing and clicking, the arthropod..."
dialogueTree.text: Hissing and clicking, the arthropod extends its mandible-like antennae to greet you again. You're right below it, looking up at the colossal chitin of its white limbs. Its small eyes look at nothing in particular.

links.title: You: "(Look behind you.) "It's smelling m..."
links.text: (Look behind you.) "It's smelling me..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe it *is* real, the pheromone...."
links.text: "Maybe it *is* real, the pheromone..." The lieutenant's mouth is agape.

links.title: Authority: "About now he is ready to believe in..."
links.text: About now he is ready to believe in anything.

links.title: Cuno: ""This is so sick. It *likes* you......"
links.text: "This is so sick. It *likes* you..." The kid's mouth is agape.

links.title: You: "(Look up.) "You're smelling me...""
links.text: (Look up.) "You're smelling me..."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The insect's head is crowned with r..."
links.text: The insect's head is crowned with reed-like scales, the shape of seed heads. They rustle as the air moves. The ventricles at its abdomen continue to expanding, like lunglets...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Breathing you in -- your sour, grea..."
links.text: Breathing you in -- your sour, greasy semiochemicals on the breeze...

links.title: You: "Raise your hand slowly."
links.text: Raise your hand slowly.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The insect stops its stridulation,..."
links.text: The insect stops its stridulation, seeming to observe you. Below its crown of reeds, little pin-prick eyes detect motion, glittering. The world stands still around you.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Suddenly there is silence."
links.text: Suddenly there is silence.

links.title: Half Light: "No. Stop. Be afraid."
links.text: No. Stop. Be afraid.

links.title: You: "Raise the other hand too."
links.text: Raise the other hand too.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "As you do, the invertebrate comes t..."
links.text: As you do, the invertebrate comes to life, its limbs moving independent of each other. As if each has a mind of its own. They are white like stalks of porcelain, knitting above you.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Praying to you."
links.text: Praying to you.

links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "That's right. Pray.""
links.text: (Whisper.) "That's right. Pray."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Unwittingly the insect continues it..."
links.text: Unwittingly the insect continues its stridulations. As it moves, tuft-like structures still pretending to be plants rustle along on its joints.

links.title: Half Light: "Perhaps it is preparing to *eat* it..."
links.text: Perhaps it is preparing to *eat* its god?

links.title: You: ""Don't pray to me. I'm nothing.""
links.text: "Don't pray to me. I'm nothing."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The reed-creature does not stop its..."
links.text: The reed-creature does not stop its stridulations -- it towers above you, parting the reeds it emerged from. Tuft like structures still rustle on its joints.

links.title: You: "Put your hands down instead."
links.text: Put your hands down instead.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Sets of complex eyes follow you --d..."
links.text: Sets of complex eyes follow you --droplets of dew on either side of the head.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Shifting around in the reeds around..."
links.text: Shifting around in the reeds around it, in the muddy water... you notice some of its hind legs apparently standing on the water from time to time. It's *that* light...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "And... is that a glimmer in the wat..."
links.text: And... is that a glimmer in the water, below it? Like plastic? Could it be hoarding something?

links.title: You: ""Cuno... there's something there.""
links.text: "Cuno... there's something there."

links.title: Cuno: ""A nest?" The whisper is anxious. "..."
links.text: "A nest?" The whisper is anxious. "We can't get to it yet, don't scare it off. Maybe later..."

links.title: You: ""Kim... there's something there.""
links.text: "Kim... there's something there."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A nest?" The whisper is anxious. "..."
links.text: "A nest?" The whisper is anxious. "Don't do anything now. Later, when it's gone maybe..."

links.title: You: "Not now..."
links.text: Not now...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Of course, no time. The insect towe..."
links.text: Of course, no time. The insect towers above you, parting the reeds it emerged from.

links.title: You: "Put your hand down."
links.text: Put your hand down.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The invertebrate comes back to life..."
links.text: The invertebrate comes back to life, stridulating. Sets of complex eyes follow you, moving in tandem, on either side of the insect's small head.

links.title: You: ""Hello. I don't know who I am.""
links.text: "Hello. I don't know who I am."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No reply. A total, ancient silence..."
links.text: No reply. A total, ancient silence comes from its mouth, along with what appears to be some kind of foam... The stridulations of its limbs continue all around you.

links.title: You: "Stand on your tiptoes and look more..."
links.text: Stand on your tiptoes and look more closely...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You were right. Little bubbles form..."
links.text: You were right. Little bubbles form on the mouthparts of the creature -- on its segmented lower lip. It looks to be foaming, slowly. The foam is white, then yellowish...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The faintest smell, like you've nev..."
links.text: The faintest smell, like you've never felt before. Like burnt roses.

links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "Kim, it's foaming.""
links.text: (Whisper.) "Kim, it's foaming."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Careful. It may be poisonous." The..."
links.text: "Careful. It may be poisonous." The lieutenant watches you apprehensively.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The foam slowly turns a darker shad..."
links.text: The foam slowly turns a darker shade, like burnt caramel -- as the insect moves its mouthparts, masticating. The little bubbles begin to burst, one by one...

links.title: Cuno: ""Whoah... maybe it's poison? Fuckin..."
links.text: "Whoah... maybe it's poison? Fucking hell..." The kid watches you apprehensively.

links.title: You: ""Why are you're foaming?""
links.text: "Why are you're foaming?"

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Silence. Click. The foam slowly tur..."
links.text: Silence. Click. The foam slowly turns a darker tone, like burnt caramel -- as the insect moves its mouthparts, masticating on nothing in particular. Then the little bubbles begin to burst, one by one...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Letting out that same smell, like s..."
links.text: Letting out that same smell, like summer burning.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Apricot blossoms. White blossoms er..."
links.text: Apricot blossoms. White blossoms erupting. A sensation, like cold hands on your face.

links.title: You: "Let your heels drop back onto solid..."
links.text: Let your heels drop back onto solid ground.

links.title: You: "Back off."
links.text: Back off.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The invertebrate stops, raising its..."
links.text: The invertebrate stops, raising its scythe-like arms and tilting its tiny head, formed from the fused plates around its mouth. For a second, the effigy is frozen, then it nudges back into motion with a click.

links.title: You: "(Whisper) "Okay Kim, take the pictu..."
links.text: (Whisper) "Okay Kim, take the picture."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's good, it's good," the lieuten..."
links.text: "It's good, it's good," the lieutenant whispers, holding it up. "Don't worry. We got it."

links.title: Half Light: "For a moment there, he was afraid y..."
links.text: For a moment there, he was afraid you didn't *get it*, but he's calmer now, looking at it.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The arthropod towers above you -- j..."
links.text: The arthropod towers above you -- just like in the picture -- oblivious to your chattering. The ventricles on its abdomen slowly expanding, vestigial wings like barely visible gossamer hanging from the inside of its slender joints.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay..." With a slow ring of metal..."
links.text: "Okay..." With a slow ring of metal, the lieutenant slides the lens open and raises it to eye level.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "There is no change in the insects m..."
links.text: There is no change in the insects motion while its being aimed by the camera. It remains fixated on you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In three," the lieutenant whispers..."
links.text: "In three," the lieutenant whispers, his voice is tense. "If it moves, you jump back, I'll shoot. Here we go. Three, two, one..."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The shrill flash of the camera cuts..."
links.text: The shrill flash of the camera cuts the air like the blade of a sword. The phasmid freezes in its bright light -- head turned toward the lieutenant. Hypnotized by the flash, it stands frozen before you.

links.title: Shivers: "The sweat on your arms feels cold a..."
links.text: The sweat on your arms feels cold as ice. As if you're frozen as well, in the shadow of this giant statue of chitinous marble.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I got it..." You hear the lieutena..."
links.text: "I got it..." You hear the lieutenant whisper, as the creature's shape develops onto photo paper in his hand: a polychrome ghost of white streaks against the reeds and the sky. And you, as a shadow before it.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Immortalized."
links.text: Immortalized.

links.title: Inland Empire: "For all time."
links.text: For all time.

links.title: You: "*Slowly* reach out and touch the cr..."
links.text: *Slowly* reach out and touch the creature's whisker.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The antennae hang from a great heig..."
links.text: The antennae hang from a great height. With your hand shaking you barely touch the tip of the left whisker. On contact the chitin curls into a spiral, like the tip of a poison ivy. Its touch on your fingertip feels cold, ticklish...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The sensation is electrifying, reso..."
links.text: The sensation is electrifying, resounding through your body.

links.title: Interfacing: "It is surprisingly delicate -- the..."
links.text: It is surprisingly delicate -- the curly end of the whisker, like a young bine. It's even a bit wet.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Looks like someone's got hurt in a..."
links.text: Looks like someone's got hurt in a fight. This antennae is much smaller than the other one.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Be careful, detective... It's movi..."
links.text: "Be careful, detective... It's moving."

links.title: You: "Look at your finger."
links.text: Look at your finger.

links.title: Interfacing: "You were right, it glistens with so..."
links.text: You were right, it glistens with some kind of moisture. The creature in front of you stays frozen...

links.title: You: "Wipe it off."
links.text: Wipe it off.

links.title: Interfacing: "Feels like nothing. The arthropod i..."
links.text: Feels like nothing. The arthropod in front of you stays frozen...

links.title: You: "Lick your finger."
links.text: Lick your finger.

links.title: Interfacing: "It tastes like... sugar. Very faint..."
links.text: It tastes like... sugar. Very faint. The arthropod towers above you, tufts of reeds pointing from limb and head alike.

links.title: Perception (Taste): "Odourless, mostly comprised of wate..."
links.text: Odourless, mostly comprised of water.

links.title: You: "Carefully pet its scythe-like forea..."
links.text: Carefully pet its scythe-like forearm.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The limb before you is incredibly l..."
links.text: The limb before you is incredibly light, like eggshell. It's much lighter than a reed. You feel a soft push could tip the creature over, its hollow exoskeleton collapsing...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Warning!"
links.text: Warning!

links.title: Half Light: "It's about to move, you can sense i..."
links.text: It's about to move, you can sense it!

links.title: You: "Run your hand up the slender limb,..."
links.text: Run your hand up the slender limb, higher...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "A small shudder passes the creature..."
links.text: A small shudder passes the creature's arm. High above you its black pearl-eyes still glisten, mesmerized by the light passing its nervous system.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There is some kind of countdown hap..."
links.text: There is some kind of countdown happening, as it slowly processes the overwhelming brightness of the signal. The invertebrate is regaining control...

links.title: Empathy: "The stimulus overloaded it. It's pa..."
links.text: The stimulus overloaded it. It's passing, like an extended moment, or a gall stone.

links.title: Interfacing: "Here, within the smooth white inner..."
links.text: Here, within the smooth white inner part of its limb you sense... something very intimate. Thoughts.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, it's thinking with its..."
links.text: "Lieutenant, it's thinking with its *limbs*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The nervous system could be spread..."
links.text: "The nervous system could be spread out like that..." He whispers behind you. "Over the extremities, like a cuttlefish."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Or a *ryacintha*, an Occidental lea..."
links.text: Or a *ryacintha*, an Occidental leaf insect with its brain stored in four leaf-like extensions. Or a mimicry octopus with its intelligent tentacles...

links.title: You: "It's your secret alone."
links.text: It's your secret alone.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Another shudder passes through the..."
links.text: Another shudder passes through the forearm under your palm -- feels like blood pumping through a brain. It's coming to, you withdraw your hand slowly.

links.title: You: "Pull your hand away."
links.text: Pull your hand away.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "A sudden shiver passes the limb. Lo..."
links.text: A sudden shiver passes the limb. Looks like the creature is awakening, wave by wave from its stupor.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Some sort of countdown process is h..."
links.text: Some sort of countdown process is happening. That's all you have time to think...

links.title: You: ""We got it..." (Back off.)"
links.text: "We got it..." (Back off.)

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Another shudder pulses through the..."
links.text: Another shudder pulses through the creatures limbs. It jolts back to life, like a record continuing were it left off -- in a swaying, praying motion. Even the small black pearls of its eyes do not stray from you...

links.title: Suggestion: "They are filled with adoration and..."
links.text: They are filled with adoration and curiosity. The adoration of some wheel,  or dominion spinning around its parent deity. And the curiosity of a common wasp, tasting sugar in a fizzy drink.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "A shudder pulses through the creatu..."
links.text: A shudder pulses through the creatures limbs. It jolts back to life, like a record continuing were it left off -- in a swaying, praying motion. Even the small black pearls of its eyes do not stray from you...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Don't say it! Are you sure? This ma..."
links.text: Don't say it! Are you sure? This may be the only chance you get to touch it...

links.title: You: "(I'm sure.) "We got it, Kim..." (Ke..."
links.text: (I'm sure.) "We got it, Kim..." (Keep backing.)

links.title: You: "No, wait..."
links.text: No, wait...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The arthropod towers above you, fro..."
links.text: The arthropod towers above you, frozen in place. A twitch passes one of its hind legs, as you...

links.title: You: "Tell me -- what are you doing?"
links.text: Tell me -- what are you doing?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I exist."
links.text: I exist.

links.title: You: "I exist too."
links.text: I exist too.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Tell me what it's like for you."
links.text: Tell me what it's like for you.

links.title: You: "Fire, burning."
links.text: Fire, burning.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Fire? Where?"
links.text: Fire? Where?

links.title: You: "Inside."
links.text: Inside.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I do not have fire inside me. In me..."
links.text: I do not have fire inside me. In me there is not even blood, but lymph -- like sap from a wine palm.

links.title: You: "In the city, all around. It's going..."
links.text: In the city, all around. It's going *down*.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I am oblivious to the city. It is o..."
links.text: I am oblivious to the city. It is only on my margins. A ball I sometimes spin. A toy, Or the cylinder of a discarded trash bin.

links.title: You: "On the horizon. Pale fire. This thi..."
links.text: On the horizon. Pale fire. This thing we're both sensing is coming to an end.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "That is your problem. Nothing ever..."
links.text: That is your problem. Nothing ever ends for me. There is only room for two, maybe three pictures in my mind.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "For me it is a series of half-lit i..."
links.text: For me it is a series of half-lit images. A kind of darkness, being intruded upon. Transient. Dim. Moist.

links.title: Conceptualization: "So what if the next picture doesn't..."
links.text: So what if the next picture doesn't come? This creature is not the photographer, just the camera.

links.title: You: "It's *wunderbar*."
links.text: It's *wunderbar*.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes, holy is the lord of hosts. And..."
links.text: Yes, holy is the lord of hosts. And all the Earth is filled with his glory.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Now I will tell you what it's like..."
links.text: Now I will tell you what it's like for me. For me it is a series of half-lit images. A kind of darkness, being intruded upon. Transient. Dim. Moist.

links.title: You: "I'm ill."
links.text: I'm ill.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "What is your illness?"
links.text: What is your illness?

links.title: You: "My body aches. I'm bleeding."
links.text: My body aches. I'm bleeding.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I smelled it, as soon as you steppe..."
links.text: I smelled it, as soon as you stepped on the island -- strawberries. Fresh burst of red strawberries. Ripe turning riper. Soon you will be rotten.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Now I will tell you how it is for m..."
links.text: Now I will tell you how it is for me. For me it is a series of half-lit images. A kind of darkness, being intruded upon. Transient. Dim. Moist.

links.title: You: "I'm ill in my head. I'm insane. Tha..."
links.text: I'm ill in my head. I'm insane. That's how it is for me.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I am not. There isn't even a centra..."
links.text: I am not. There isn't even a central nervous system in my head. Only mouthparts for eating wetland plants.

links.title: You: "In my heart. For me it's sadness --..."
links.text: In my heart. For me it's sadness -- input after input.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "For me it is not like that. I have..."
links.text: For me it is not like that. I have states, not emotions. For example, I experience excitement at unexpected sugar rewards, but that is not important.

links.title: You: "If I tell you, what will happen?"
links.text: If I tell you, what will happen?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Then I will tell you what it's like..."
links.text: Then I will tell you what it's like for me.

links.title: You: "Intruded upon -- by what?"
links.text: Intruded upon -- by what?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Shapes of plants and animals. And *..."
links.text: Shapes of plants and animals. And *internal* sensations. A swarm of sounds, tiny vibrations on the inside of my forearms -- all speak of complexities totally beyond my understanding.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I am at the end of a narrow funnel...."
links.text: I am at the end of a narrow funnel. Weightless. So light it only feels like *something* to be me. In truth -- perhaps I'm nothing? I certainly do not have a soul. And if I did, it would never ache.

links.title: You: "You're the type of animal I would l..."
links.text: You're the type of animal I would like to be.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Are you sure?"
links.text: Are you sure?

links.title: You: "Yes I'm sure. Why do you ask?"
links.text: Yes I'm sure. Why do you ask?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Sometimes, when moulting, I regrow..."
links.text: Sometimes, when moulting, I regrow a lost limb. One time something went wrong and a small leg replaced a missing antenna.

links.title: You: "That's absolutely nothing."
links.text: That's absolutely nothing.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The leg tried to move around indepe..."
links.text: The leg tried to move around independently, making it hard to walk.

links.title: You: "You don't have a foot there now!"
links.text: You don't have a foot there now!

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes, thankfully someone ate it. The..."
links.text: Yes, thankfully someone ate it. The next time I moulted I grew an antenna again!

links.title: Physical Instrument: "This would explain its antenna bein..."
links.text: This would explain its antenna being smaller.

links.title: You: "*This* is the explanation I came up..."
links.text: *This* is the explanation I came up with?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "No -- it's what the three metres ta..."
links.text: No -- it's what the three metres tall stick insect came up with.

links.title: You: "Got it. Solved it."
links.text: Got it. Solved it.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Officially, it was the three metres..."
links.text: Officially, it was the three metres tall stick insect who solved it.

links.title: You: "See! It's nothing."
links.text: See! It's nothing.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes, compared to the immeasurable,..."
links.text: Yes, compared to the immeasurable, fiery empyrean of glass and terror in *your* head, it seems trivial. I just thought you should know.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Maybe you would find it interesting..."
links.text: Maybe you would find it interesting!

links.title: You: "All's well that ends well."
links.text: All's well that ends well.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes, I am lucky. It is nothing comp..."
links.text: Yes, I am lucky. It is nothing compared to the horror that is you -- with all of creation reflected in your forebrain. A nerve mirror of horrifying fidelity. Constant, never-ending damnation.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It would take a million years of ev..."
links.text: It would take a million years of evolution -- or a total reversal in the condition of the world -- for your pain to end.

links.title: You: "Way worse has happened to me."
links.text: Way worse has happened to me.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Of course, it is nothing compared t..."
links.text: Of course, it is nothing compared to the horror that is you -- with all of creation reflected in your forebrain, in terrible fidelity, a fire mirror. Eternal, never-ending damnation.

links.title: You: "Okay. I don't want to hear more abo..."
links.text: Okay. I don't want to hear more about that.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "So, you see, it's sometimes difficu..."
links.text: So, you see, it's sometimes difficult to be an insect. All of nature is a kind of horror, or strife -- though none of it as horrible as you. With all of creation reflected in your forebrain.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "So, you see, it's sometimes also di..."
links.text: So, you see, it's sometimes also difficult being a stick insect. The leg tried to move independently, making it hard to walk. But hearing about it makes you uncomfortable, I understand.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Change of topic!"
links.text: Change of topic!

links.title: You: "A small leg. That's horrible."
links.text: A small leg. That's horrible.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes. The leg tried to move around i..."
links.text: Yes. The leg tried to move around independently, making it hard to walk.

links.title: You: "That's cool."
links.text: That's cool.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No. The leg tried to move around in..."
links.text: No. The leg tried to move around independently, making it hard to walk.

links.title: You: "No, I'm not. Why are you asking?"
links.text: No, I'm not. Why are you asking?

links.title: You: "I'm glad to be me -- an incredibly..."
links.text: I'm glad to be me -- an incredibly sensitive instrument.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Few of us can begin to imagine the..."
links.text: Few of us can begin to imagine the horror of you -- with all of creation reflected in your forebrain. It must be like the highest of hells, a kaleidoscope of fire and writhing glass. Eternal damnation.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Even when you're sleeping... And wh..."
links.text: Even when you're sleeping... And when you wake, you carry it around on your neck. With eyes open that cannot help but swallow more behind the mirror. I feel great, mute empathy for you.

links.title: You: "It's hell. I change my mind. I want..."
links.text: It's hell. I change my mind. I want to be you.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You want to be a phasmid? Are you s..."
links.text: You want to be a phasmid? Are you sure?

links.title: You: "It was very disorienting at first,..."
links.text: It was very disorienting at first, but I'm keeping my shit together.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "That must be incredibly hard. The a..."
links.text: That must be incredibly hard. The arthropods are in silent and meaningless awe of you. Know that we are watching -- when you're tired, when the vision spins out of control. The insects will be looking on. Rooting for you.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "And when you fall we will come to r..."
links.text: And when you fall we will come to raise you up, bud from you, banner-like, blossom from you and carry you apart in a sky funeral. In honour of your passing. (But not me, because I am just a leaf eater.)

links.title: Volition: "In honour of your shit, lieutenant-..."
links.text: In honour of your shit, lieutenant-yefreitor. Which you kept *together* in the face of total, unrelenting terror. Day after day. Second by second.

links.title: Inland Empire: "DETECTIVE"
links.text: DETECTIVE

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "ARRIVING"
links.text: ARRIVING

links.title: Authority: "ON THE SCENE"
links.text: ON THE SCENE

links.title: Volition: "In honour of your will, lieutenant-..."
links.text: In honour of your will, lieutenant-yefreitor. That you kept from falling apart, in the face of sheer terror. Day after day. Second by second.

links.title: You: "The fuck is happening to me right n..."
links.text: The fuck is happening to me right now?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I don't know. You're just a shadow..."
links.text: I don't know. You're just a shadow for me. Far away, faintly transmitting, but for a curious smell.

links.title: You: "I am a detective."
links.text: I am a detective.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "So am I. I was born to detect sucro..."
links.text: So am I. I was born to detect sucrose rewards and semiochemicals. What were you born to detect?

links.title: You: "Also that."
links.text: Also that.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I can also detect pheromones -- the..."
links.text: I can also detect pheromones -- the ones on you tell me that you will not eat me. And that I will benefit from your closeness. In short, I love you.

links.title: You: "The killer."
links.text: The killer.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "He is in a bad state, deteriorating..."
links.text: He is in a bad state, deteriorating fast now. He thinks I am beneficial to him, but I am not. I only quicken his deterioration.

links.title: You: "You're destroying him?"
links.text: You're destroying him?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Very slowly -- and only because he..."
links.text: Very slowly -- and only because he won't go away. It is meant to keep them from noticing me, to interfere with the pictures in their heads. But he has looked at me too long. And I'm destroying him.

links.title: You: "I was born to detect you."
links.text: I was born to detect you.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes. No one detected me for such a..."
links.text: Yes. No one detected me for such a long, long time. For thousands of years. I dithered, out of sight. Draped myself in greenery.

links.title: You: "This is my masterpiece."
links.text: This is my masterpiece.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No one believed I exist -- almost n..."
links.text: No one believed I exist -- almost no one. Until you came, detective. Dripping of blood that smells like strawberries. Across the calm sea, the first in a thousand years.

links.title: You: "No. This is just an accident."
links.text: No. This is just an accident.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No. No one believed I exist -- almo..."
links.text: No. No one believed I exist -- almost no one. Until you came, detective. Dripping of blood that smells like strawberries.  Across the calm sea, the first in a thousand years.

links.title: You: "Is this a dream? What is happening?"
links.text: Is this a dream? What is happening?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No. You are awake. I am real. Light..."
links.text: No. You are awake. I am real. Light is forming me. This is real.

links.title: You: "Where does this come from? All this..."
links.text: Where does this come from? All this? Around us? The world?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Not even the birds know that. Not e..."
links.text: Not even the birds know that. Not even the water lilies.

links.title: You: "We need to know. Perhaps it's sent..."
links.text: We need to know. Perhaps it's sent to us by a god?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "*I* think we should eat it. If it's..."
links.text: *I* think we should eat it. If it's a leaf you can put it in your mouth. Or a reed. Yum yum.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait, so..."
links.text: Wait, so...

links.title: You: "So you look like a reed, and you ea..."
links.text: So you look like a reed, and you eat reeds?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes. They don't mind."
links.text: Yes. They don't mind.

links.title: You: "Have you accidentally eaten another..."
links.text: Have you accidentally eaten another reed-phasmid?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes. I once cloned myself and ate t..."
links.text: Yes. I once cloned myself and ate the little ones. It was winter and I woke up at the wrong time. It was an accident.

links.title: You: "Too sensitive of a matter."
links.text: Too sensitive of a matter.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Yes, of course. The three metres ta..."
links.text: Yes, of course. The three metres tall stick insect would be offended.

links.title: You: "Then all we can do is beat our fist..."
links.text: Then all we can do is beat our fists against it? Day after day. With no answer.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You can also eat it. If it's a leaf..."
links.text: You can also eat it. If it's a leaf you can put it in your mouth. Yum yum. Or a reed.

links.title: You: "What exactly *are* you?"
links.text: What exactly *are* you?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I am an unknown species of the orde..."
links.text: I am an unknown species of the order Phantasmodea -- endemic to the Insulindian isola. For the last three hundred and fifty years I have hidden in plain sight, masquerading as the reeds. Moulding, cloning myself, unfolding at night to play with trash bins and buoys.

links.title: Half Light: "It may have unknown, dangerous bioc..."
links.text: It may have unknown, dangerous biochemical characteristics that help it maintain its camouflage.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I went unnoticed by the first settl..."
links.text: I went unnoticed by the first settlers and the land surveyors of the suzerain. Also by the soldiers of the Revolution and the officials of the occupation. Even the Semenese islanders who came here first, but did not stay, have not seen me.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "And the 4,000-year-old Seraseolitic..."
links.text: And the 4,000-year-old Seraseolitic civilization buried so deep in the sediment that you do not even know it is there -- they too did not see me.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I have stayed hidden through four f..."
links.text: I have stayed hidden through four forms of government and two scientific revolutions. Until I was accidentally discovered by a detective of the Citizens Militia in Revachol, district of Martinaise, March, '51.

links.title: You: "Are you poisonous?"
links.text: Are you poisonous?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes. I do not have a startle displa..."
links.text: Yes. I do not have a startle display, so I use a neurodegenerative allomone to aid in camouflage. Do not worry, it is only destructive over long periods of time.

links.title: Logic: "The Deserter, he's been here for a..."
links.text: The Deserter, he's been here for a *long* time.

links.title: You: "Was there an ancient Seraseolitic c..."
links.text: Was there an ancient Seraseolitic civilization?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes -- with stone tools and silk. T..."
links.text: Yes -- with stone tools and silk. They too missed me, although I had not developed the mutation needed for parthenogenesis yet, and scoured the neolithic hinterland as distinct individuals, not clones.

links.title: You: "That's insane."
links.text: That's insane.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No. *You* are. The moral of our enc..."
links.text: No. *You* are. The moral of our encounter is: I am a relatively median lifeform -- while it is you who are total, extreme madness. A volatile simian nervous system, ominously new to the planet.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The pale, too, came with you. No on..."
links.text: The pale, too, came with you. No one remembers it before you. The cnidarians do not, the radially symmetricals do not. There is an almost unanimous agreement between the birds and the plants that you are going to destroy us all.

links.title: You: "Wait, what is the pale?"
links.text: Wait, what is the pale?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "It is a nervous shadow cast into th..."
links.text: It is a nervous shadow cast into the world by you, eating away at reality. A great, unnatural territory. Its advent coincides with the arrival of the human mind.

links.title: You: "Wait, the pale is human made?"
links.text: Wait, the pale is human made?

links.title: You: "I don't have that kind of power."
links.text: I don't have that kind of power.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You are a violent and irrepressible..."
links.text: You are a violent and irrepressible miracle. The vacuum of cosmos and the stars burning in it are afraid of you. Given enough time you would wipe us all out and replace us with nothing -- just by accident.

links.title: You: "...how?"
links.text: ...how?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "We suspect it will be something lik..."
links.text: We suspect it will be something like the oxygen holocaust that wiped out anaerobic life 2.6 billion years ago -- when organisms first started breathing. Only much worse.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Instead of air, you exhale thoughts..."
links.text: Instead of air, you exhale thoughts. There are no trees that eat thoughts.

links.title: You: "Worse how?"
links.text: Worse how?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Everything your eyes touch goes bac..."
links.text: Everything your eyes touch goes back there -- behind the nerve mirror. What if you blink? Are we still here? (Please don't blink). What if you misplace us all one day -- or just forget?

links.title: You: "Blink. (Quick.)"
links.text: Blink. (Quick.)

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Please do not do that again."
links.text: Please do not do that again.

links.title: You: "Have I always thought this way?"
links.text: Have I always thought this way?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No -- you're only thinking it *now*..."
links.text: No -- you're only thinking it *now*. This is a revelation.

links.title: You: "But I *want* to blink and undo 12 b..."
links.text: But I *want* to blink and undo 12 billion years of matter expansion.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Simian butcherer... Soon, one of yo..."
links.text: Simian butcherer... Soon, one of you will close your eyes -- and open them to see that none of this ever existed.

links.title: You: "This is the Gloaming I've been wait..."
links.text: This is the Gloaming I've been waiting for. Ever since I woke up in the hotel room.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "So it is *already* happening. One d..."
links.text: So it is *already* happening. One day, one of you will close your eyes and sigh -- and open them to see that none of this ever existed.

links.title: You: "I have already forgotten the whole..."
links.text: I have already forgotten the whole world once -- when I drank too much.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "So it is already happening. Soon, o..."
links.text: So it is already happening. Soon, one of you will close your eyes -- and open them to see that none of this ever existed.

links.title: You: "I will be extra extra careful not t..."
links.text: I will be extra extra careful not to blink, stick insect. Don't worry.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Please be. Or one day one of you wi..."
links.text: Please be. Or one day one of you will close your eyes and sigh -- and open them to see that none of this ever existed.

links.title: You: "I don't want to know."
links.text: I don't want to know.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Also very, very dangerous."
links.text: Also very, very dangerous.

links.title: You: "Are you the miracle?"
links.text: Are you the miracle?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No. You are the miracle."
links.text: No. You are the miracle.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It was you. Coming from the west. F..."
links.text: It was you. Coming from the west. From the Whirling. You were coming...

links.title: You: "*How?*"
links.text: *How?*

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The moral of our encounter is: I am..."
links.text: The moral of our encounter is: I am a relatively median lifeform, while you are extreme, all-engulfing madness. A volatile simian nervous system, ominously new to the planet.

links.title: You: ""Kim. Am I having a violent epilept..."
links.text: "Kim. Am I having a violent epileptic seizure?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It doesn't look like that, no.""
links.text: "It doesn't look like that, no."

links.title: You: ""What does it look like?""
links.text: "What does it look like?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're just staring at it," he whi..."
links.text: "You're just staring at it," he whispers.

links.title: You: ""Then, I think I'm having a vision...."
links.text: "Then, I think I'm having a vision. About the final fate of mankind."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay." After a second the lieutena..."
links.text: "Okay." After a second the lieutenant asks: "Is it somehow related to the case?"

links.title: You: ""Sort of.""
links.text: "Sort of."

links.title: You: ""No. I told you what it's about. Ou..."
links.text: "No. I told you what it's about. Our fate."

links.title: You: ""The case? The case is meaningless..."
links.text: "The case? The case is meaningless compared to this." (Laugh nervously.) "I have totally transcended the case."

links.title: You: ""Nothing. Just looking at the stick..."
links.text: "Nothing. Just looking at the stick insect. Everything is normal."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think you should back away from..."
links.text: "I think you should back away from the unstudied species now..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think we should take the picture..."
links.text: "I think we should take the picture -- and then you should *back away* from the unstudied species."

links.title: You: ""Okay good. Forget it.""
links.text: "Okay good. Forget it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. What's going on?""
links.text: "No. What's going on?"

links.title: You: ""I think I'm having a vision. About..."
links.text: "I think I'm having a vision. About the final fate of mankind."

links.title: You: ""Cuno. Am I having a violent epilep..."
links.text: "Cuno. Am I having a violent epileptic seizure?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Doesn't look like you're spazzin'..."
links.text: "Doesn't look like you're spazzin' out" he whispers behind you. "Cuno knows all about seizures."

links.title: You: ""What does it look like?""
links.text: "What does it look like?"

links.title: Cuno: ""You're just staring at the giant i..."
links.text: "You're just staring at the giant insect."

links.title: You: ""I think I'm having a vision. About..."
links.text: "I think I'm having a vision. About the final fate of mankind."

links.title: Cuno: ""Cool. So's Cuno -- Cuno's also hav..."
links.text: "Cool. So's Cuno -- Cuno's also having a vision of a *giant insect*. And it's *real*. Back off before it eats you..."

links.title: You: ""Nothing. Just looking at the stick..."
links.text: "Nothing. Just looking at the stick insect. Everything is normal."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah -- real normal. There's a gia..."
links.text: "Yeah -- real normal. There's a giant stick insect there. Back off, before it eats you..."

links.title: You: ""Okay good. Forget it.""
links.text: "Okay good. Forget it."

links.title: Cuno: ""No, quit frontin'. What's up with..."
links.text: "No, quit frontin'. What's up with you? We're a team, cop."

links.title: You: "Am I having a violent epileptic sei..."
links.text: Am I having a violent epileptic seizure?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "It doesn't look like that."
links.text: It doesn't look like that.

links.title: You: "What does it look like?"
links.text: What does it look like?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You're staring at me. For about thr..."
links.text: You're staring at me. For about three minutes now.

links.title: You: "Then, I think I'm having a vision...."
links.text: Then, I think I'm having a vision. About the final fate of mankind.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "What if it's not you? What if the t..."
links.text: What if it's not you? What if the three metres tall stick insect is having the vision -- while you're alone and  petrified.

links.title: You: "Okay. Just looking at the stick ins..."
links.text: Okay. Just looking at the stick insect. Everything is normal.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Yes. For me everything is *always*..."
links.text: Yes. For me everything is *always* normal. God is in his heaven -- everything is normal on Earth.

links.title: You: "Okay good. Forget it."
links.text: Okay good. Forget it.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "I already did."
links.text: I already did.

links.title: You: "I have to say good bye now. I have..."
links.text: I have to say good bye now. I have no more thoughts. That was all.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Good bye. A series of chirrups surr..."
links.text: Good bye. A series of chirrups surrounds you, like swallows on a cliff side, as the phasmid moves its forearms -- tymbals visible on the inside of its white stalks...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "No. There is *one* more."
links.text: No. There is *one* more.

links.title: You: "No. There are no more thoughts."
links.text: No. There are no more thoughts.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "A series of chirrups surrounds you,..."
links.text: A series of chirrups surrounds you, like swallows on a cliff side, as the phasmid moves its forearms -- tymbals visible on the inside of its white stalks...

links.title: You: "Of all the creatures I've met you a..."
links.text: Of all the creatures I've met you are the kindest.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Thank you. I also have one final th..."
links.text: Thank you. I also have one final thing to say to you: that woman -- turn from the ruin. Turn and go *forward*.

links.title: You: "I can't."
links.text: I can't.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "She was middle class. It doesn't ta..."
links.text: She was middle class. It doesn't take a three-metre stick insect to tell you that.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "She was hell on Earth. It doesn't t..."
links.text: She was hell on Earth. It doesn't take a three-metre stick insect to tell you that.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "She was hell on Earth. It doesn't t..."
links.text: She was hell on Earth. It doesn't take a three-metre stick insect to tell you that.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "She was hell on Earth. It doesn't t..."
links.text: She was hell on Earth. It doesn't take a three-metre stick insect to tell you that.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "She was hell on Earth. It doesn't t..."
links.text: She was hell on Earth. It doesn't take a three-metre stick insect to tell you that.

links.title: You: "I will try."
links.text: I will try.

links.title: You: "I will."
links.text: I will.

links.title: You: "What woman?"
links.text: What woman?

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You cannot lie to me. Behind you it..."
links.text: You cannot lie to me. Behind you it smells of fires. So awfully far you were prepared to go in her presence. End it.

links.title: You: "Of all the creatures I've met you a..."
links.text: Of all the creatures I've met you are the scariest.

links.title: You: "Of all the creatures I've met you a..."
links.text: Of all the creatures I've met you are the most beautiful.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Nothing. Its simple eyes give off n..."
links.text: Nothing. Its simple eyes give off no flicker of light, no one is home. The twitches of its limbs are insect-like, unknowable, perhaps without substance even.

links.title: You: "I want to see inside you."
links.text: I want to see inside you.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "It is impossible to see inside. The..."
links.text: It is impossible to see inside. There is only chitin, pretending to be reeds -- or polished, like stalks of marble. The occasional series of clicks, undecipherable to the human ear.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Suddenly -- another flash of pain...."
links.text: Suddenly -- another flash of pain. Worse than the one before. The taste of blood in your mouth. The insect tastes it too, twitching suddenly...

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Another flash of pain. Again you sw..."
links.text: Another flash of pain. Again you swallow it, but this time, some of it does not stay down. You think you taste it in your mouth. So does the insect, twitching suddenly...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "In its marrow -- a combination of c..."
links.text: In its marrow -- a combination of complex biomolecules. Hormones, amino acids, lipids.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "What more is there in any of us? Yo..."
links.text: What more is there in any of us? You think, as the sight of the insect fades and pain shoots up your right foot and into your abdomen, darkening your view... when it returns the insect twitches, feeling the blood on you...

links.title: Pain Threshold: "The sight of the insect pulses with..."
links.text: The sight of the insect pulses with pain, as a streak of fire tries to shoot up your leg. You swallow it. Unmoved. Not now. There's blood dripping... warm.  The creature must feel it too, it twitches.

links.title: You: "I want there to be more."
links.text: I want there to be more.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Mute, the insect foams from its mou..."
links.text: Mute, the insect foams from its mouthparts, tilting the plates of its fused together head. From left to right, without reason.

links.title: You: "I want to know your mind."
links.text: I want to know your mind.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "There is no mind to speak of. And i..."
links.text: There is no mind to speak of. And if there is, it's beyond your imagination -- too simple to be compatible with yours. Segmented mouthparts foam, it tilts its head.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "It's spread too thin among its limb..."
links.text: It's spread too thin among its limbs, performing incomprehensible operations on the world; and you -- looking at it, mouth slightly open... You cannot even imagine what it thinks.

links.title: You: "Disengage slowly. [Leave.]"
links.text: Disengage slowly. [Leave.]

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "As you're turning away, the phasmid..."
links.text: As you're turning away, the phasmid mirrors your movements, stepping on the water -- the long limbs carry its feather weight without breaking its surface.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "And just like that it's gone -- ska..."
links.text: And just like that it's gone -- skating away across the sea's calm mirror like a skipping stone, leaving nothing but  circles on the water...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "...and something under it! In the p..."
links.text: ...and something under it! In the place it stood, bobbing there, among the reeds. A collection of items.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's gone..." The lieutenant looks..."
links.text: "It's gone..." The lieutenant looks north, with his hand raised to his brow.

links.title: You: ""You didn't get the picture?""
links.text: "You didn't get the picture?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No." You have rarely seen him with..."
links.text: "No." You have rarely seen him with that face.

links.title: Empathy: "He is *very* disappointed you didn'..."
links.text: He is *very* disappointed you didn't warn him -- or plan it with him...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We are now just another pair of cr..."
links.text: "We are now just another pair of crackpots who did not take a picture of the giant cryptid.... Maybe we'll get another chance? We *know* it's here now..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He cannot believe what he's saying..."
links.text: He cannot believe what he's saying too much.

links.title: You: ""It can walk on water?""
links.text: "It can walk on water?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Apparently, yes -- like a water st..."
links.text: "Apparently, yes -- like a water strider, only..." He shakes his head with amazement. "I've never seen *anything* like that in my life."

links.title: You: ""What's that -- in the reeds?""
links.text: "What's that -- in the reeds?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He squints. "Looks like a nest of s..."
links.text: He squints. "Looks like a nest of some sort? We should have a look."

links.title: You: ""What now?" [Leave.]"
links.text: "What now?" [Leave.]

links.title: The Deserter: ""What now..." the old man behind yo..."
links.text: "What now..." the old man behind you repeats suddenly. He's put his hand into the ash -- it's dirty and black.

links.title: Empathy: "In some kind of strange, semi-catat..."
links.text: In some kind of strange, semi-catatonic state.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our suspect is not looking so good..."
links.text: "Our suspect is not looking so good. We need to check on him."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our suspect is not looking so good..."
links.text: "Our suspect is not looking so good. We need to check on him -- also..." He points to the reeds.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like the insect had some..."
links.text: "It looks like the insect had some kind of nest there, look... Maybe it has left *some* proof..."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "In the reeds, where the phasmid was..."
links.text: In the reeds, where the phasmid was hiding, you see a little flash of white -- *porcelain* white.

links.title: Cuno: ""It's gone..." Cuno stares to the n..."
links.text: "It's gone..." Cuno stares to the north. "Between those reeds there. Fucking hell it can..."

links.title: You: ""It can walk on water.""
links.text: "It can walk on water."

links.title: Cuno: ""Like a water spider, or like -- on..."
links.text: "Like a water spider, or like -- one of those water walkers..." He's lost for words, just pants from excitement. "This cop shit is *insane*"

links.title: You: ""What's that, in the water?""
links.text: "What's that, in the water?"

links.title: Cuno: ""The fuck..." He squints. "Is that..."
links.text: "The fuck..." He squints. "Is that *ceramic*? And more stuff -- like a *nest* in the reeds. We should peep it... fucking hell..."

links.title: You: ""What now?" [Leave.]"
links.text: "What now?" [Leave.]

links.title: The Deserter: ""What now..." the old man behind yo..."
links.text: "What now..." the old man behind you says suddenly. He's put his hand into the ash -- it's dirty and black.

links.title: Empathy: "In some kind of strange, semi-catat..."
links.text: In some kind of strange, semi-catatonic state.

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah, grandpa's not looking so goo..."
links.text: "Yeah, grandpa's not looking so good. We need to check on him..."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yo, our suspect's not looking so g..."
links.text: "Yo, our suspect's not looking so good. We need to check on him -- also," he points to the reeds.

links.title: Cuno: ""It looks like the phasmid had some..."
links.text: "It looks like the phasmid had some kind of *nest* there -- look. Like a hoard, man..."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "In the reeds, where he's pointing,..."
links.text: In the reeds, where he's pointing, you see a flash of white -- *porcelain* white.

links.title: You: "What *is* that?"
links.text: What *is* that?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Looks like material for some kind o..."
links.text: Looks like material for some kind of nest. You should search it.

links.title: You: "Forget about it. It walked on water..."
links.text: Forget about it. It walked on water!

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Yes, it's light enough to do that...."
links.text: Yes, it's light enough to do that. Keep your eyes on the prize, it looks like material for some kind of nest there. You should search it.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Nothing but you, a detective of the..."
links.text: Nothing but you, a detective of the RCM, standing there with your mouth agape.

links.title: Authority: "Nothing but you, a detective of the..."
links.text: Nothing but you, a detective of the RCM, standing there with your mouth agape.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "As you back off the phasmid also ta..."
links.text: As you back off the phasmid also takes a step back into the reeds. Something tells you -- the next time you engage and disengage it will probably flee.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The arthropod follows you with its..."
links.text: The arthropod follows you with its antennae. As you back off, the cracks and hisses of the tape that's come to its end grow more distant...

links.title: Empathy: "Something stirs in the insect as yo..."
links.text: Something stirs in the insect as you begin to back off. It seems to also takes a step back... Something tells you -- the next time you engage and disengage it will probably flee.

dialogueTree.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The creature appears to have forgiv..."
dialogueTree.text: The creature appears to have forgiven your nerves -- for now. There it still stands, a thin ghost on stilt-like legs. Antennae hang from its head, like curled strands of human hair.

links.title: You: "Listen carefully..."
links.text: Listen carefully...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Sssss-hsssss-tik-ssssss-hssss-tik....."
links.text: Sssss-hsssss-tik-ssssss-hssss-tik...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You smell..."
links.text: You smell...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Tik-tik-tik... hisss... tik-tik-tik..."
links.text: Tik-tik-tik... hisss... tik-tik-tik... hisss....

links.title: Inland Empire: "Be afraid. You smell wrong."
links.text: Be afraid. You smell wrong.

links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "This is the Insulindian..."
links.text: (Whisper.) "This is the Insulindian phasmid."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is," the lieutenant whispers be..."
links.text: "It is," the lieutenant whispers behind you. You hear the familiar ring of his jacket unzipping -- slowly. Painstakingly so...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "You glance over your shoulder. The..."
links.text: You glance over your shoulder. The lieutenant holds a piece of milled aluminium. He begins to pull it open, extremely carefully -- it's the camera!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No! The flash will scare the creatu..."
links.text: No! The flash will scare the creature off! Warn him NOW!

links.title: You: "(Point to it.) "What is that?""
links.text: (Point to it.) "What is that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My camera.""
links.text: "My camera."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No! The sound of the flash will sca..."
links.text: No! The sound of the flash will scare the creature off. Warn him NOW!

links.title: You: ""Kim..." (Whisper.) "The flash is l..."
links.text: "Kim..." (Whisper.) "The flash is loud. It won't like that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We *need* a photo -- no one will b..."
links.text: "We *need* a photo -- no one will believe us." He continues to pull the lens open...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "From the corner of your eye, you se..."
links.text: From the corner of your eye, you see a sudden cascade of motion ripple through the insect's limbs. A series of ultrasonic clicks fills your ear...

links.title: Half Light: "I am not palatable. Do not eat me...."
links.text: I am not palatable. Do not eat me. I am afraid.

links.title: You: ""Okay, take the picture.""
links.text: "Okay, take the picture."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "With the sound of metal sliding aga..."
links.text: With the sound of metal sliding against metal, the lieutenant reveals the lens. The glass glints in his hand as he begins to slide in an ampoule...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You see the insect turn to him, its..."
links.text: You see the insect turn to him, its mandible antennae reaching out. Its motions are quick, sudden.

links.title: Authority: "Something cracks in the lieutenant...."
links.text: Something cracks in the lieutenant. He's letting his pride get in the way.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The ampoule will produce a loud hi..."
links.text: "The ampoule will produce a loud hiss." He turns to you and whispers: "You're right. It could scare it away. I need a better moment, when it's not looking."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'll wait. I'm on standby, he think..."
links.text: I'll wait. I'm on standby, he thinks, his hands sweaty around the machine.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The spindly mechanism turns itself..."
links.text: The spindly mechanism turns itself back to you, its antennae taking their measure of the air, slowly...

links.title: You: ""Stop. Let me approach it first.""
links.text: "Stop. Let me approach it first."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I won't be one of those fools who..."
links.text: "I won't be one of those fools who didn't take a picture..." He has stopped fiddling with the camera, but does not put it down.

links.title: Authority: "He's letting his pride get in the w..."
links.text: He's letting his pride get in the way.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "You see the insect turn to him, its..."
links.text: You see the insect turn to him, its mandible antennae reaching out. Its motions are quick, sudden.

links.title: You: "(Whisper) "Who cares what they *thi..."
links.text: (Whisper) "Who cares what they *think* Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He comes to, abruptly. "Understood...."
links.text: He comes to, abruptly. "Understood. Of course," he says with a nod.

links.title: You: "(Whisper) "I have the pheromone, I..."
links.text: (Whisper) "I have the pheromone, I can approach it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think the pheromone will d..."
links.text: "I don't think the pheromone will do anything." His whisper turns to a sceptical hiss -- but he has stopped now.

links.title: You: ""Just listen to me!""
links.text: "Just listen to me!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Shh... okay." The lieutenant puts..."
links.text: "Shh... okay." The lieutenant puts his finger to his lips and nods.

links.title: You: "(Whisper) "Are you sure you won't s..."
links.text: (Whisper) "Are you sure you won't scare it off?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We need a photo -- or no one will..."
links.text: "We need a photo -- or no one will believe us." He continues to pull the lens open...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "You glance over your shoulder. The..."
links.text: You glance over your shoulder. The lieutenant holds a piece of milled aluminium. He begins to pull it open, extremely carefully...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Looks like camera! Yes!"
links.text: Looks like camera! Yes!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No! The flash will scare the creatu..."
links.text: No! The flash will scare the creature. Warn him NOW!

links.title: Cuno: ""...the Insulindian phasmid," he fi..."
links.text: "...the Insulindian phasmid," he finishes your sentence in awe.

links.title: Logic: "Oh my god, *Kim* had the camera!"
links.text: Oh my god, *Kim* had the camera!

links.title: You: ""Wait, how do you know about the ph..."
links.text: "Wait, how do you know about the phasmid?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Everybody does. It's the fucking I..."
links.text: "Everybody does. It's the fucking Insulindian phasmid."

links.title: You: ""God, Kim had a camera. Do you?""
links.text: "God, Kim had a camera. Do you?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah..." He shakes his head. "I do..."
links.text: "Yeah..." He shakes his head. "I don't have a camera. That sucks about Cuno."

links.title: Empathy: "Cuno can't believe how bad he is, w..."
links.text: Cuno can't believe how bad he is, without a camera -- in this situation the binoclard would be superior in every way.

links.title: Empathy: "Cuno can't believe how lame he is -..."
links.text: Cuno can't believe how lame he is -- without the camera right now. Should have stolen one, a real cop would have one...

links.title: You: ""Cuno, do you have a camera or some..."
links.text: "Cuno, do you have a camera or something?"

links.title: The Deserter: "No one hears you whisper. Behind yo..."
links.text: No one hears you whisper. Behind you, the straggler sits despondently by the fire, oblivious to his surroundings.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Meanwhile, in the antechamber of th..."
links.text: Meanwhile, in the antechamber of the Station 57 lazareth, a neatly packed pair of cargo pants and a black bomber jacket sit in a locker. Nested on the jacket -- a small block of milled aluminium, tucked away in a leather case.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "An instant camera -- the Trigat Sun..."
links.text: An instant camera -- the Trigat Sunshine Mini. A moan of discomfort sounds from the lazareth, as he turns onto his side...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Back on an island 28 kilometres awa..."
links.text: Back on an island 28 kilometres away, the gigantic insect moves its antennae, taking its measure of the air, slowly... it's searching for something -- *you*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "A camera -- an instant colour camer..."
links.text: A camera -- an instant colour camera the lieutenant keeps tucked away in his coat pocket. A moan of discomfort sounds from the lazareth, as he turns onto his side...

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "He not as much as glances at the gi..."
links.text: He not as much as glances at the gigantic insect to his right -- nor does it look at him. Its antennae take their measure of the air, slowly... searching for something -- *you*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Meanwhile, in the antechamber of th..."
links.text: Meanwhile, in the antechamber of the Station 57 lazareth, a neatly packed pair of cargo pants and an orange bomber jacket sit in a locker. Nested on the jacket -- a small block of milled aluminium, tucked away in a leather case.

links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "What is that?""
links.text: (Whisper.) "What is that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have absolutely no idea..." The..."
links.text: "I have absolutely no idea..." The lieutenant whispers back. You hear the familiar ring of his jacket unzipping -- slowly. Painstakingly so...

links.title: You: "(Say something to the insect, quiet..."
links.text: (Say something to the insect, quietly, like...)

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "..."
You: ""Hey.""
links.text: "Hey."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "The creature tilts its tiny head to..."
links.text: The creature tilts its tiny head to the side and appears to look at you. It is incredibly light, like the slightest gust of wind should blow it away, but it doesn't...

links.title: Empathy: "There is a sadness in there -- or i..."
links.text: There is a sadness in there -- or is it in you, from the dream... It's still with you, the pitiful *hey* you told her, even now...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The air moves through it. Its slend..."
links.text: The air moves through it. Its slender sticks.

links.title: You: ""Don't be afraid...""
links.text: "Don't be afraid..."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "Nothing changes in the cyclical, pr..."
links.text: Nothing changes in the cyclical, praying motion of the creature's limbs. They are porcelain white on the inside, and reed-coloured on the out -- beige, light brown and striped. You are unsure if it is scared or not.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Its insect mind is impenetrable to..."
links.text: Its insect mind is impenetrable to your reasoning.

links.title: You: ""You exist...""
links.text: "You exist..."

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "A sudden chirrup fills the air -- t..."
links.text: A sudden chirrup fills the air -- the walking stick moves its whole body, limbs working independently of each other, like the parts of a masterfully constructed machine.

links.title: Empathy: "It moves just an inch closer to you..."
links.text: It moves just an inch closer to you. Or does it only *feel* like it does?

links.title: Composure: "Something in its body language has..."
links.text: Something in its body language has changed, just slightly...

links.title: You: "Approach carefully."
links.text: Approach carefully.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Slowly, with your breath held, you..."
links.text: Slowly, with your breath held, you take two small steps toward the phasmid. The creature lets out a series of ultrasonic clicks that swarm around your head like swallows...

links.title: Empathy: "Like laughter. A sort of happiness."
links.text: Like laughter. A sort of happiness.

links.title: Endurance: "Sweat drips from your brow, soaking..."
links.text: Sweat drips from your brow, soaking your chest... you reek of it, your chemicals.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The tracheal system on the creature..."
links.text: The tracheal system on the creature's abdomen expands in front of you, to take in and expel air -- it's *smelling* you.

links.title: Insulindian Phasmid: "...hissing and clicking, it extends..."
links.text: ...hissing and clicking, it extends its mandible-like antennae to greet you. You're right below it now, looking up at the colossal chitin of its white limbs. The head of the creature is crowned by reeds and its eyes are like small droplets of water.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You barely get to take one step --..."
links.text: You barely get to take one step -- the invertebrate reacts with uncanny speed, skating away across the water. It's gone, like a skipping stone, leaving nothing but rings on the sea's calm mirror...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "It's blending into the tufts of ree..."
links.text: It's blending into the tufts of reeds in the distance! Moving from islet to islet...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Where? Where did it go?" The lieut..."
links.text: "Where? Where did it go?" The lieutenant has the camera in one hand -- and a slip of white paper in the other, developing.

links.title: You: "(Yell.) "No!""
links.text: (Yell.) "No!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Your voice echoes on the water."
links.text: Your voice echoes on the water.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Three-hundred metres inland special..."
links.text: Three-hundred metres inland special consultant Trant Heidelstam cups his ear. Satellite-Officer Vicquemare nods to him on the jetty: "I heard it."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""He must be *really* out of it, yel..."
links.text: "He must be *really* out of it, yelling like that. Well, at least he's *alive*...." Officer Minot in the blue uniform frowns: "Jean, maybe something *happened*? He's in distress..."

links.title: You: ""I don't understand... I *had* the..."
links.text: "I don't understand... I *had* the pheromone...."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think..." He tries to expl..."
links.text: "I don't think..." He tries to explain, patting slightly: "I don't think it had *anything* to do with the ox-spray. It was just scared."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There is uncertainty in his phrasin..."
links.text: There is uncertainty in his phrasing.

links.title: Half Light: "It *definitely* had something to do..."
links.text: It *definitely* had something to do with the ox-spray! It was repelled by you, as if it was scared.

links.title: You: ""It *did* have something to do with..."
links.text: "It *did* have something to do with the ox-spray!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, but..." He shakes his head i..."
links.text: "Okay, but..." He shakes his head in disbelief. "I'm not an entomologist, okay? Neither was the para-scientist. Who knows? The only thing I'm sure of is..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "There's a flicker of a smile on his..."
links.text: There's a flicker of a smile on his lips, like he can't believe what he's saying: "We *saw* it -- it was real."

links.title: You: ""It was *definitely* that. He didn'..."
links.text: "It was *definitely* that. He didn't like me. I didn't get to take a single step."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Like* you?" He shakes his head in..."
links.text: "*Like* you?" He shakes his head in disbelief. "I'm not an entomologist, okay -- neither was the para-scientist. Who knows, maybe you're right. The only thing I'm sure of is..."

links.title: You: ""Okay, yes, you're probably right.""
links.text: "Okay, yes, you're probably right."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Am I?" He shakes his head. "I don'..."
links.text: "Am I?" He shakes his head. "I don't know. I'm not an entomologist! Neither was the para-scientist. The only thing I'm sure of is..."

links.title: You: ""I shouldn't have taken a bath, the..."
links.text: "I shouldn't have taken a bath, the pheromone washed off!"

links.title: You: ""I should have taken the pheromone..."
links.text: "I should have taken the pheromone from Morell!"

links.title: You: ""Damn, we should have helped the cr..."
links.text: "Damn, we should have helped the cryptozoologists."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Helped them?" He falls silent for..."
links.text: "Helped them?" He falls silent for a moment. "I don't see what more we could have done?"

links.title: You: ""We could have learned something ab..."
links.text: "We could have learned something about the phasmid's behaviour. Searched for it with them."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I know. We *should* have... It's m..."
links.text: "I know. We *should* have... It's my fault too." He looks across the water. The slip of photo paper still drying in his hand, just hanging there for a second.

links.title: Empathy: "It's too late now."
links.text: It's too late now.

links.title: Volition: "He subdues the feeling. Dusts himse..."
links.text: He subdues the feeling. Dusts himself off and moves on. So should you. There will be other chances.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Relax. Now that you *know* it's her..."
links.text: Relax. Now that you *know* it's here -- how long can it hide?

links.title: You: ""We should have been more thorough..."
links.text: "We should have been more thorough Kim. We should have..."

links.title: You: ""You're right.""
links.text: "You're right."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not. We should have... it's my..."
links.text: "I'm not. We should have... it's my fault too." He looks across the water. The slip of photo paper still drying in his hand, hanging despondently for a second.

links.title: You: ""What in the name of *god* was that?""
links.text: "What in the name of *god* was that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A stick insect of some sort. Prete..."
links.text: "A stick insect of some sort. Pretending to be the reeds..." He shakes his head. "Has it been there the whole time?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Someone must have known about it t..."
links.text: "Someone must have known about it though. Maybe there's some secret to approaching it? I have no idea... I've never heard of a species like that."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Neither have you. But you know who..."
links.text: Neither have you. But you know who would -- a cryptozoologist!

links.title: Reaction Speed: "A cryptozoologist? Oh god, there wa..."
links.text: A cryptozoologist? Oh god, there was one...

links.title: You: ""The cryptozoologist! There was one..."
links.text: "The cryptozoologist! There was one in the bar. Maybe she knew something?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The paraplegic? *Or* the other one..."
links.text: "The paraplegic? *Or* the other one on the coast? They could have, yes..." He seems unsure.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "We missed it, he thinks. We damn mi..."
links.text: We missed it, he thinks. We damn missed a spot. We should have... then the lieutenant collects himself.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I never thought the damn *cryptozo..."
links.text: "I never thought the damn *cryptozoology* would factor into this... Well, we know it's here now. We *will* find it again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The paraplegic? She could have, ye..."
links.text: "The paraplegic? She could have, yes..." He seems unsure.

links.title: You: ""Where did it go?" (Look north.) Ca..."
links.text: "Where did it go?" (Look north.) Can *you* see it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No." He shakes his head. "It's gon..."
links.text: "No." He shakes his head. "It's gone for now, detective."

links.title: You: ""I think it went into the reeds the..."
links.text: "I think it went into the reeds there, on that islet..." (Point North.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like it doesn't like to stay..."
links.text: "Looks like it doesn't like to stay out in the open for long." The lieutenant squints where you're pointing.

links.title: You: ""How did it *do* that? Glide?""
links.text: "How did it *do* that? Glide?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It appears the insect can walk on..."
links.text: "It appears the insect can walk on water. Like a water strider, you know. It's almost as fast..." He stops, short of breath. "Uncanny..."

links.title: You: ""Tell me you got the picture...""
links.text: "Tell me you got the picture..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He shakes his head. In silence -- a..."
links.text: He shakes his head. In silence -- an expression on his face that you've never seen there before.

links.title: Composure: "Like a little boy... for a moment h..."
links.text: Like a little boy... for a moment he's unable to keep it together when he looks at the slip.

links.title: You: ""You didn't get the picture?""
links.text: "You didn't get the picture?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No..." He shows you the white slip..."
links.text: "No..." He shows you the white slip of photo paper. There's a rainbow of colour -- blue, white, yellow, and brown like a child's painting.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Even a wildlife photographer couldn..."
links.text: Even a wildlife photographer couldn't make out a familiar form, let alone a gigantic stick insect.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I tried," he explains. "But it was..."
links.text: "I tried," he explains. "But it was moving too fast. And I didn't get the ampoule in right. And..." He gathers himself. "Dammit. I believe my eyes. It *was* there."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "However hard you squint you can't m..."
links.text: However hard you squint you can't make out anything recognizable, let alone a stick insect.

links.title: You: "Say nothing, swallow it."
links.text: Say nothing, swallow it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's just a blur," he says, lookin..."
links.text: "It's just a blur," he says, looking at the slip of paper in his hand.

links.title: You: ""Did you get it, did you get the pi..."
links.text: "Did you get it, did you get the picture?"

links.title: You: ""What now?" (Continue.)"
links.text: "What now?" (Continue.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""What now..." the old man behind yo..."
links.text: "What now..." the old man behind you repeats suddenly. He's put his hand into the ash -- it's dirty and black.

links.title: Empathy: "In some kind of strange, semi-catat..."
links.text: In some kind of strange, semi-catatonic state.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our suspect's not looking so good...."
links.text: "Our suspect's not looking so good. We should check him over -- also..." He points to the reeds.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like it has some kind of..."
links.text: "It looks like it has some kind of nest there... Maybe there's proof in there."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "In the reeds, where the phasmid was..."
links.text: In the reeds, where the phasmid was hiding, you see a little flash of white -- porcelain white.

links.title: You: ""Damn it! Damn it! I didn't get it..."
links.text: "Damn it! Damn it! I didn't get it right..." [Leave in rage.]

links.title: Suggestion: "You never had a chance. There was s..."
links.text: You never had a chance. There was something off the moment you approached it. It was scared of you. Of humans.

links.title: Cuno: ""Fuck. Where did it go?""
links.text: "Fuck. Where did it go?"

links.title: You: "(Yell.) "No!""
links.text: (Yell.) "No!"

links.title: Cuno: "Your voice echoes alone on the wate..."
links.text: Your voice echoes alone on the water. The kid looks at you...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Three-hundred metres inland special..."
links.text: Three-hundred metres inland special consultant Trant Heidelstam cups his ear. Satellite-Officer Vicquemare nods to him on the jetty: "I heard it."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""He must be *really* out of it, yel..."
links.text: "He must be *really* out of it, yelling like that. Well, at least he's *alive*...." Officer Minot in the blue uniform frowns: "Jean, maybe something *happened*? He's in distress..."

links.title: You: ""I don't understand... I *had* the..."
links.text: "I don't understand... I *had* the pheromone...."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yo, we just saw a giant fucking in..."
links.text: "Yo, we just saw a giant fucking insect, okay? Focus on that, not some..." He looks around. "Where'd it go?"

links.title: Half Light: "It *definitely* had something to do..."
links.text: It *definitely* had something to do with that! It was repelled by you, as if it was scared.

links.title: You: ""There was a pheromone -- like an o..."
links.text: "There was a pheromone -- like an ox-spray. I had to have it on and I didn't."

links.title: Cuno: ""The fuck -- *pherone*? Man, this a..."
links.text: "The fuck -- *pherone*? Man, this ain't about no phermone! This is about the *phasmid*. Did you *see* the size of that?!"

links.title: You: ""Okay, yes, you're probably right...."
links.text: "Okay, yes, you're probably right. I won't panic."
